next_reply.content:
Hello Precious Ayomide, my name is Nonso nwune. Welcome to JAMB Support Centre, 

I understand you're reaching out to us again regarding your sister's admission status. It appears there's some confusion stemming from a previous UTME-to-DE conversion and a possible name error in your CUIIA congratulatory message. 

Let's address these one at a time:

**Regarding your sister's DE conversion:** 

As previously explained, the UTME-to-DE conversion is irreversible. Unfortunately, this means she can't use her UTME scores for admission anymore. Her best course of action is to explore options for the DE program at her chosen institution. 

**Regarding your name in the CUIIA message:**

It's great that you received your admission message! Congratulations! However, I understand the concern about the typo in your name. 

While your school mentioned the correction has been made, I strongly recommend reaching out to CUIIA's admissions department directly to confirm this. Having consistent records across all platforms is crucial to prevent issues later. 

**JAMB Regularization:**

Don't delay your JAMB regularization process. It's crucial to align your admission with JAMB records regardless of the minor name discrepancy. You can proceed with regularization while confirming the name change with CUIIA.

If you encounter any problems during regularization specifically due to the name typo, please don't hesitate to contact us again with specific details of the issue. 

We're here to assist you in navigating these processes. 

Best regards,

Nonso Nwune
JAMB Support Centre
